thread.title: Punjab Assembly election results LIVE: Who will win state's three-cornered fight?
thread.title_full: Punjab Assembly election results LIVE: Who will win state's three-cornered fight?

title: Punjab Assembly election results LIVE: Who will win state's three-cornered fight?
text:
Punjab Assembly election results LIVE: Who will win state's three-cornered fight? IndiaToday.in , March 11, 2017 7:22:30 IST 
For the first time in recent history, Punjab is witnessing a three-cornered fight for its 117-seat Assembly. 

The ruling Shiromani Akali Dal-Bharatiya Janata Party alliance, which has been in office for two terms, is facing a tough fight from the Congress and state politics debutant, Aam Aadmi Party. 

If exit polls are to be believed, the SAD-BJP combine is looking at a rout, with some polls predicting that the alliance will fail to even reach double digits in the 2017 Vidhan Sabha polls. Counting begins at 8 am at 54 centres in 27 locations where the state election commission has deployed more than 14,000 officials. 07:22 IST: During the 2012 Assembly election, the Shiromani Akali Dal won 56 seats while the Bharatiya Janata Party won 12 seats. 07:16 IST: Referring to the recent weather in north India, Punjab Education Minister Daljit Singh Cheema said, "The clouds are in the sky, this is a sign that Badals are coming back." 07:03 IST: Fun fact: Captain Amarinder Singh is celebrating is 75th birthday today. 06:41 IST: BSP has fielded 111 candidates and Trinamool Congress is contesting on 20 seats. 06:40 IST: Former AAP leader Sucha Singh Chhotepur's Apna Punjab Party (APP) has fielded candidates on 77 seats. 23:09 IST: The ruling SAD has 94 contestants and its ally BJP has 23 candidates. 23:09 IST: The Congress has fielded candidates on all 117 seats, AAP is contesting on 112 seats. 23:09 IST: A total of 1,145 candidates are in fray for Punjab's 117 Assembly seats. Watch Right Now
